title: South Africa: Cosatu North West Reminds the Minister of Transport to Reduce the Most Expensive Tollgate Fees
text:
Zimbabwe: Mujuru Fight Personal, About Gossip - Grace Mugabe 
We have been waiting for too long, and now need or demand a clear written response from the office of the Minister with her consultations from the Treasury regarding the reducing of the toll gate as it was announced publicly that it will be reduced to R58. 
And now, it's almost over three months! 
We are now preparing our members to go back to the toll gate road , if we are not getting a clear response on when will the toll gate be reduced and also when will the advocacy campaign start for a discount program. 
We are giving the Minister of Transport until the end of the month of July 2015 and failure which, we will take our campaign back to the N4 road at the end of the month. 
COSATU North West will also incorporate the struggle against exploitation of workers employed by Bakwena in the same vein. 
COSATU North West demands that all Bakwena workers be declared permanent. 
We also want to be on record that no worker, who was on a protected strike must be subjected to a disciplinary hearing. 
And no worker must be subjected to any form of an intimidation and victimization by employer. 
We call SANRAL and its friends Bakwena to stop its attitude against the workers and respect the rights of workers. South Africa
